pageTitle: Itinerary for Saturday, September 17, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Saturday, September 17, 2016:

Montréal, Quebec

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Official Greeting of Leaders.

International Civil Aviation Organization
Leader’s Entrance, St. Antoine Street.
999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa
Montréal, Quebec

Notes for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity
  • Access for media will be prior to 8am and after 9am for the media sweep.


9:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with His Excellency Stefan Lofven, Prime Minister of Sweden.

International Civil Aviation Organization
Room 7B, Level 3
999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with His Excellency Ban Ki-Moon, United Nations Secretary-General.

International Civil Aviation Organization
Room 7B, Level 3
999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


10:40 a.m. The Prime Minister will hold a meeting with Bono.

International Civil Aviation Organization
Room 7B, Level 3
999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


1:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Closing Session of the Global Fund Fifth Replenishment Conference.

International Civil Aviation Organization
Assembly Hall, Level 4
999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Open media coverage


2:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a closing press conference.

International Civil Aviation Organization
Delegate Lounge Area, Level 3
999 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Open media coverage


4:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will take part in the ONE Campaign Town Hall.

Hotel William Gray
421 Rue Saint Vincent
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Open media coverage


7:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will co-host the Global Citizen Concert to End AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria.

Bell Centre
1909 Avenue des Canadiens-de-Montréal
Montréal, Quebec

Note for media:

  • Open media coverage


PMO Media Relations:
media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
613-957-5555
